posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked: Hi everyone, Our team is switching from limelight to photonvision, and I tried to implement the example code but it keeps crashing. Am I missing something? Thanks in advance! Here is the code (I can’t seem to get GitHub to work for some reason): Robot.java (7.5 KB)

link_counts.title: Aiming at a Target - PhotonVision Docs

posts.cooked: It's really important that the software doesn't crash. Could you explain what happens when it crashes and what the error message says?

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked: Here is the screenshot and the log file of the error. Below you will find the associated code_troubleshooting.json file located at /uploads/short-url/wzv9LPJdSPefP8OSlREXQ2iW6e0.json.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: At some point in your code, you're passing this.config to a Swerve controller. Make sure this.config exists; otherwise, it'll throw an exception.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked: It would be helpful if you shared your entire code project as a link to a repo on GitHub. Interestingly, the error usually isn’t in the file you’ve been looking at.

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked: Finally managed to get github working github.com/Another-Person1/FRC2025-Offseason Contribute to Another-Person1/FRC2025-Offseason development by creating an account on GitHub. GitHub - Another-Person1/FRC2025-Offseason
The robot is failing because it's initializing the SwerveDrive component with too many null values.

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked: I changed that to use the SwerveSubsytem.java file made by a different team member, but it still isn't autoaligning. However, it isn't crashing.

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked: Update: I switched to PathPlanner and calibrated the camera, but it still doesn't autoalign. The Photon Client — Mozilla Firefox 2025-07-23 12:13:40 PM was downloaded successfully, and its size is 1920×1140 pixels with a file size of 358 KB.
